ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned so much in this course!! Both practical skills and information in lecture are so useful and I am incredibly happy with the content of the course.
how to process, manipulate, and analyze satellite imagery
Knowledge about the earth and its systems and skills to use satellite imagery.
I thoroughly learned so much about remote sensing and loved the class.
Learned how to use ENVI - super applicable and helpful in the real world

We not only were given the means to download, manipulate, and analyze satellite imagery, but we were given an extremely in-depth context to the science behind remote sensing. We briefly touched upon the orbits of satellites, properties of reflectance, the electromagnetic spectrum, the statistics behind image classification and the science of the atmosphere. With our individual projects, there were plenty of applications not discussed in class that we could have implemented and reviewed. That being said, the content of the course could look very different depending on the direction of your final project. Because of this, I was able to become fairly competent in Arcmap.
Very technical skills that offered a new approach to looking at environmental (or any kind) issues.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It was a great course! Sometimes slightly more guidance may have been helpful but I learned a lot by working through it on my own.

strengths: engaging, interesting, thorough instructions for the labs, Tarek was amazing.
weaknesses: I wish that there had been more time spent on how to obtain our own images and what to check for while obtaining images

Strength- Keer and Tarek. 
Weakness- it was hard to hear and understand the zoom classes
Learning envi is tedious but Tarek and Keer were super helpful always

This was an incredibly strong course. The labs were a great addition to the course. I enjoyed getting some hand on experience and apply what we covered in lecture. I also really enjoyed the final few weeks of the semester where researchers from various disciplines explained how remote sensing can be used in each of their fields. I feel like, while very broad, the lecture content gave me the background necessary to understand exactly what I was doing when interacting with satellite data and guide my approach to solving the issues that arose as I executed my final project. The open-ended final project was a great opportunity to think creatively regarding how remote sensing can be used as a versatile tool. I was VERY appreciative of how we didn't have any homework or exams in the second half of the semester. This gave me the chance to make my final project actually come together in time.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would highly recommend this course!! It is a lot of work and dedication due to the lab component but very worth it and I learned a lot.
I would absolutely recommend! This is an excellent course that is very interesting even if you have no goals of doing remote sensing in the future
Definitely!! Really reasonable instructors who assign meaningful work.

I would definitely recommend this course to anyone interested in any research that has to do with a large stretch of land. The applications of remote sensing are truly limitless and with some creativity it can be used to answer some pretty outlandish questions. Seeing the completion of everyone's final project at the end of the course really goes to show how the course excels in giving students what they need to actually understand and apply remote sensing to answer the questions they find most interesting. Working with the data can be frustrating and time consuming at times, but with enough patience and planning this course is an absolute pleasure to take.
